metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2339 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
An exploitable heap overflow vulnerability exists in the Fiddle::Function.new "initialize" function functionality of Ruby. In Fiddle::Function.new "initialize" heap buffer "arg_types" allocation is made based on args array length. Specially constructed object passed as element of args array can increase this array size after mentioned allocation and cause heap overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2339` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
libtcltk-ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
ri1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
ruby1.9.1-examples - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
ruby1.9.1-full - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
ruby1.9.3 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

libruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.4
ruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.4
ruby2.0-tcltk - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby1.9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3').
ruby2.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.4').
